overview.heading: What is Vagrant?
overview.body: Vagrant is the command line utility for managing the lifecycle of virtual machines. Isolate dependencies and their configuration within a single disposable and consistent environment.

get_started.heading: Getting Started
get_started.body: Use Vagrant to create and configure a reproducible and portable work environment.

blocks.heading: Use HCP Login for Vagrant Cloud
blocks.body: Create a new HCP account or link your existing one to Vagrant Cloud.

cards.title: Boxes
cards.description: The package format for Vagrant environments - create your own or use one from the public catalog.

cards.title: Install and Specify a Box
cards.description: Use a base image to quickly clone a virtual machine.

cards.title: Vagrantfile
cards.description: Describe your virtual machine's configuration and how to provision it.

cards.title: Create a Vagrantfile
cards.description: Begin your Vagrant project by creating a Vagrantfile.

cards.title: vagrant up
cards.description: Create and configure your virtual machine with the single most important Vagrant CLI command.

cards.title: Boot an Environment
cards.description: Start your virtual machine with vagrant up.

cards.title: Synced Folders
cards.description: Sync files from your host machine to the guest machine.

cards.title: Synchronize Your Files
cards.description: Vagrant automatically syncs files to and from the guest machine allowing you to edits files locally and run them in your virtual machine.

cards.title: Networking
cards.description: Access your virtual machines through the high-level networking set up by Vagrant.

cards.title: Configure Your Network
cards.description: Forward network traffic from your local machine to your virtual guest machine running on Vagrant.

cards.title: Plugins
cards.description: Add additional functionality to Vagrant via plugins.

cards.title: Providers
cards.description: Manage other types of machines via providers.

cards.title: Triggers
cards.description: Execute commands on your system before or after Vagrant operations.

cards.title: Vagrant Share
cards.description: Share your Vagrant environment with anyone via a single command.

cards.title: The Nomad Autoscaler
cards.description: Try out the autoscaling feature of HashiCorp Nomad in a Vagrant environment.

cards.title: Data Encryption in Vault
cards.description: Try out data encryption in a Java application with HashiCorp Vault in a Vagrant environment.

blocks.heading: Contributing to Vagrant
blocks.body: HashiCorp has some community guidelines to ensure our public forums are a safe space for everyone. When contributing to Vagrant, please respect the same guidelines.

blocks.heading: Vagrant vs. Other Software
blocks.body: Vagrant is not the only tool to manage virtual machines and development environments.
